text:
Behind me is called Mosquito Bay. It might not be the most
appealing name but it is one of the most
beautiful in the entire world. It's got muddy brown water, and sure there are a few flying

insects but to see the secret, you have to stay up
past your bedtime and check it out

at night. It's hiding something really
special.

I went to Vieques expecting a cool light show,
but what I found here was one of the
most amazing things I've ever seen

There's a
bioluminescent plankton living in the

Bay that phosphoresces when you disturb
the water. All that means is there's a

little creature that cause a chemical
reaction that produces a flash of light

just like a firefly, but you can fit
three of these on the tip of the needle.

This isn't the only place in the world
you can find this little creatures but

this bay has the highest concentration
of them, and that makes it the brightest
in the entire world. With a normal camera, all you really see is black. So I brought

mine along that allowed me to capture
this light the way the human eye sees it
for one of the very first times
That was so cool. Bio Bay is a must see. Big love to Black Beard Sports for having a cup of kayaks and
Experiences over Possessions, Kick the Grind!
